metadata.Title: CVE-2020-22217 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow vulnerability in c-ares before 1_16_1 thru 1_17_0 via function ares_parse_soa_reply in ares_parse_soa_reply.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-22217` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libc-ares2 - 1.15.0-1ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: c-ares package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.15.0-1ubuntu0.4').
